Row.Text: Ma'at

Clears all features and improves all possible tiles. Likes civilizations with a high percentage of improved tiles. Dislikes civilizations with low percentage of improved tiles or that found National Parks.
I am Ramses, beloved of Amun. Every country trembles before me, fear in their hearts.
Fire your arrows at the sun. Strike your swords against the flood. It will have the same effect.
Look upon my armies, ye mighty, and despair.
We build that our name will not die out.
Do you think that you can cultivate sand?
Defeat me, but my monuments will stand over the glory that was Ramses, king of kings.
It is done. A partnership between the black land of Horus and yours.
To sit at the same table? To agree as equals? I think not.
Shall you be a friend to the eternal kingdom?
So it shall be; a union as of Osiris and Isis!
We have no peer.
Your delegation has seen the wonders of my realm. They might be a bit sad to come home.
The cobra's scales shine like gems in the sun. But we do not desire to grasp it. So it is with your gifts.
I bring to you a small glimpse of the wonders of Egypt: jewels of gold and lapis, ivory and bone. These cost many deben, but we have them in abundance.
Did a jackal bark, just now?
I shall let you rave on, that all will know you to be mad. (Denounces You)
I invite you to visit our lands, though you will despair to see its glory, and salt the river with your tears.
Yes
I can tell you of the heart of the sun, and the eternal change of the rivers. And you can tell me of wherever you're from.
How does it feel to stand in my presence? To stand so close to the sun?
The red and white crown shine ever brighter when they are combined into one.
The flood abates.
The lioness of war still rages through the land. I cannot call her back.
Sekhmet has drunk enough. Shall we agree to peace?
Wander our lands, but know they are not your own.
Egypts borders remain walls of stone to you.
We have need to pass through your lands and ask only that your people not gaze upon our troops, lest they be blinded by their radiance.
The sun does not abide other lights in the sky when it shines. So I cannot abide your forces near me.
I deny you this.
So let it be written. So let it be done.
Lion of Mali
Wants to be the civilization with the most [ICON_Tourism] Tourism, dislikes those who compete in [ICON_Tourism] Tourism.
I am Sundiata Keita, my light overleaps the mountains and shines out from Mali upon the world.
As long as I breathe, Mali will never be your thrall.
After the war of mouths, swords must decide.
Wisdom is contained in words, songs, and stories - the words, songs and stories of Mali.
With your people, everyone thinks that they know the true stories, but true wisdom is held in memory.
Alas, my city, my home, is now a place for the guinea fowl and partridge bathe in the dust.
A great king forgets nobody.
A great king forgets nobody.
You cannot chose your relatives, but we may choose our friends. I choose you.
Our deeds are nothing without a friend to tell the tale!
Kings forget their humility. It is only natural.
We have spent the night listening to the songs of the griot and dreaming of the time of heroes. Which is now.
I do not have the time to escort foreigners about my kingdom.
My kingdom is not yet rich - perhaps my grandchildren may make it so. But we send to you lamb in peanut butter stew, that we call tiguadege na, and a leopard-skin chair to sit upon while you eat.
A serpent that remains hidden will grow old. You have revealed yourself.
They call me a lion. I have heard you called a jackal. (Denounces You)
Here, you may hear the griots' song directly from their mouths!
Agreed!
You have heard the songs echoing across the plains, no? Shall we tell you their source?
Welcome, welcome!
We will announce this bond to the assembled warriors.
Let the hunters return to the savannah. They are happier there.
A wounded snake may still strike. One must stamp it out.
Dawn comes, and the lion sleeps.
I wandered these lands as a boy, that you may do so now.
Alas, no. There are lions.
We travel far. Will you ease our passage?
Your warriors stray far from their hunting grounds.
This we cannot do.
I am happy to agree.
They are pleased to see another well fed civilization
They dislike civilizations with low food
Basilike Ge
Tries to build up [ICON_Food] Food, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Food] Food.

{LOC_DIPLO_GREETING_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
All of our grand divine aspirations begin with a bit of bread, is it not so?
(Your are strong in food production)
I hear your people make a porridge of ashes and twigs. Tell me, is that true?
(Your food production is lacking)
{LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_ALLIANCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

{LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_REFUSE_DEAL_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
{LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

{LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_TOO_MANY_TROOPS_NEAR_ME_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
I am impressed with how well you feed your people.
You are not doing much to prevent your population from growing. What do your people eat?
